intro: Hemiadelphis polysperma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, which bloom from the leaf axils. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Hemiadelphis polysperma is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
